summary: Florence Cathedral, officially named the Cathedral of Saint Mary of the Flower, is a famous church in Florence, Italy. Its construction began in 1296 and was completed in 1436, featuring a stunning dome designed by Filippo Brunelleschi. The cathedral's exterior is beautifully decorated with colorful marble panels. It is part of a larger complex, including the Baptistery and Giotto's Campanile, which is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The cathedral is one of the largest in Italy and was once home to the largest dome in western Europe, made entirely of bricks.
title: Florence Cathedral
